courseDescription:
This course, Introduction to Human Resource Concepts, will provide you with an understanding of the jobs and tasks you will have as a human resource assistant and strategies to successfully do these tasks for almost any job field where human resources is utilized. You will learn about attracting and retaining employees. You will be able to explain the recruiting process, selection process, and orientation for new employees. You will also learn about training and development of new employees and how to most effectively train employees for the job they are needed in.
This course then explains performance appraisal. You will learn about the legal environment of human resource management and the labor laws to follow when working with employees. You will also learn about forming effective teams and getting the most out of teamwork.
This course then wraps up with motivating employees. You will learn Contemporary Motivation Theory and motivation techniques used when appropriately motivating employees. By taking this course you will learn introductory skills used when working in human resources in almost any job field. So why wait? Start learning today.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Human Resources Assistant Introduction, students will learn about the primary objectives of an HR assistant. Objectives such as development of a superior workforce, Personal, ongoing development, and the safety of the workforce. The course will also be a useful tool to see potential careers you can find as an HR assistant.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Attracting and Retaining Employees, students will learn about human resources management. This also covers human resources planning. Students will also learn about forecasting the demand for, and supply of, new employees. The module will also cover matching as well as cultural diversity.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Recruiting, Selection, and Orientation, students will learn about the process of recruiting new employees and integrating them into your company. The module will cover job analysis to help you identify the key traits needed in a recruit. Students will also learn about the selection process. It will finally cover the orientation process.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Training and Development, students will learn about the training new employees and furthering their development. The module will go over personal development and professional development. Students will also learn about the five basic training methods. The module will also cover how to evaluate your training program.
topics: Topic A - Personal and Professional Development

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Performance Appraisal, students will learn about performance appraisal. The module will go over common techniques of performance appraisal, such as objective methods, subjective methods, and the sample rating scale. The module will also go into detail on how to deliver performance feedback.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Legal Environment of HRM, students will learn about the various labor protection laws that you must be aware of an follow in the field of human resources. These laws include National Labor Relations Act, Labor-Management Relations Act, Fair Labor Standards Act, Equal Pay Act, Civil Rights Act, Age Discrimination in Employment Act, Occupational Safety and Health Act, Employment Retirement Income Security Act, Affirmative Action, and the Americans with Disabilities Act.
topics: Topic A - National Labor Relations Act
Topic C - Occupational Safety and Health Act

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Motivating Employees, students will learn about historical perspectives on motivation, and how to use these methods and theories to motivate employees. Students will learn about Abraham Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs theory. It will then cover Frederick Herzberg's theory of motivation.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Contemporary Motivation Theory students will learn about Equity Theory and Expectancy Theory. The module will cover the weakness of Maslow and Herzberg’s theories. Students will learn about details of equities such as inputs and outcomes. The module will also talk about Goal Setting Theory.
topics: Topic A - Weakness of Maslow and Herzberg’s Theories

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Motivation Techniques, students will learn about techniques to help motivate employees. The module will cover techniques like management by objectives. Other techniques include, Job Enrichment, Behavior Modification, Flextime, Part –Time Work and Job Sharing, Telecommuting and. Employee Empowerment.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, Teams and Teamwork, students will learn about forming and understanding teams for maximum efficiency. This module will define what a team is and the types of teams. Students will also learn the stages of development for a team. It will also cover roles within a group. Students will also learn about team cohesiveness and team conflict.
topics: Topic A - What is a Team?
